> Thieves are good as they are... perhaps the high-level ones should 
be given a minimum time limit between bombs placed, so they can't lay 
huge strings of bombs all over the map and destroy everything in one 
fell swoop.

Hey, that's the only way I can use thieves to defeat slime at times, 
besides using a poison cloud attack to anchor slimes in place. (Btw, 
that does puzzle me.  Why can't character leave an anchored poison 
cloud?)  Besides that, I have yet to create a thief who can leave a 
trail of bombs throughout an entire scenario without either killing 
himself or running out of mana.  This business of running around like 
a chicken with its head cut off shouldn't be too rampant with thieves. 
 By george if they can summon a bomb that powerfull, they shouldn't be 
terrified for 10 seconds after it explodes.  [Also, thief and 2 
clerics combination yields a very good way to build up experience 
points for a cleric without risking death to the cleric]

> Orc commanders should get upgraded Orc abilities, plus
 giving a boost to all nearby "evil" or "magic" creatures. Oh, and 
yelling for help should actually work ; P

I'd favor the presence of an orc captain giving nearby orcs a raise in 
the amount of damage done and dodging ability.  Also, I'd favor a 
"Summon formation" attack by orc captains.  The effect would be 
stronger than "yo".  I would propose giving them the ability to walk 
on water and the ability to throw a net over an opponent which would 
disable an opponent's attacks until the net was destroyed.
